Posts.Content: Got my results today. A Gleason of 6. Found cancer in 3 of 12 cores. Will set up appointment with Dr to discuss options.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today

Posts.Content: Dr did dre first, said all was normal. Did the ultrasound, said normal prostate is about 30 grams, mine was 140. He commented that may be the reason for the upturn in PSA. Now the wait for the biopsy, 12 cores, results.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Today

Posts.Content: In Dr Walsh's book he suggests that PSA should be less that 15% of the weight of the prostate. My last PSA, 4.7, was substantially lower than that so there is some encouragement. Of course, we have the wait for the biopsy results regardless.

Posts.Title: Biopsy Today

Posts.Content: April 2012 4.00 May 2013 4.35 November 2013 4.70 So Urologist recommended biopsy and I have scheduled in two weeks.
Posts.Title: Scheduled Biopsy

Posts.Content: To me AS has always been about not taking action until the surveillance shows it has become more aggressive. It seems logical that the longer you go the odds increase that your Gleason can rise. I am a 6 and only 5 months into my AS. At age 66 I like my odds. But I am using the time on AS to investigate my options. I am much more educated about PC than I was 5 months ago or even one month ago. I now know what treatments are available to me and what my insurance will pay for. I have not seen any Dr's other than my urologist but will get referrals on my next visit.
Posts.Title: A new study regarding 993 AS patients after 5 to 20 years

Posts.Content: I am 65. Dr did a DRE on my first visit in June and said prostate was enlarged but smooth.
Posts.Title: Scheduled Biopsy

Posts.Content: This story says that new studies indicate a greatly increased risk of PC if you take Omega 3. I have been taking Omega 3 daily for 19 years to help with cardiovascular condition. If its not one thing it is another.
Posts.Title: Omega 3 and PC

Posts.Content: Thank you for your welcome. The way I read the VA site you can only get benefits if you are disabled and I am semi-retired so I doubt if I qualify. But they will give a surviving spouse some benefits!
Posts.Title: New Member from Pensacola

Posts.Content: My PSA has been 4.0 for the last 4 years. The rise to 4.35 is why I have been referred. Urologist appointment is Tuesday.
Posts.Title: New Member from Pensacola

Posts.Content: Thank you for your welcome. The way I read the VA site you can only get benefits if you are disabled and I am semi-retired so I doubt if I qualify. But they will give a surviving spouse some benefits!
Posts.Title: New Member from Pensacola

Posts.Content: Just joined. So far all I have is an elevated PSA of 4.35 but is up from 4 six months ago so Dr is sending me to a urologist. Found the forum when I googled prostate cancer. Have already found that exposure to Agent Orange is a cause. I have ischemic heart disease which also has exposure to Agent Orange as a cause. The percs of being a VN vet just keep on a coming. I realize my score does not indicate by itself that I have the disease but will not be surprised if I am scheduled for the biopsy. Initial perusal indicates a lot of good information. For the record I am 65.

Posts.Title: New Member from Pensacola

Posts.Content: I was put on Proscar approximately one month ago. My first PSA after starting Proscar will be in April. The doctor said I would be on Proscar about 6 months.
Posts.Title: Choices Limited by Size of Prostate?

Posts.Content: Uro told me my prostate was 137 grams. 11/13 PSA of 4.7, biopsy of 12/13 found 3/12, max of 15%, Gleason of 6. From reading I think seeds are not a choice. Was leaning towards radiation but that would not cure problems of BPH such as weak flow. Am currently on Proscar to hopefully reduce size of prostate. How much shrinkage can I realistically expect? Next PSA scheduled for April.
Posts.Title: Choices Limited by Size of Prostate?

Posts.Content: I am a Vietnam vet and have my biopsy next week. Like I was already not worried.
Posts.Title: For Veterans with Possible Agent Orange Exposure
